content: slumberjacks by julie smutzer ravelry = knittly this worsted weight bed sock in adult sizing will make a nice convalescing nursing home or hospice gift the ribbing gives it plenty of stretch to accommodate various w idths and provide a snug fit n otes worked from the cuff down skill level intermediate experience w ith dpn sock knitting is advised materials * 140 - 200 yards approximate of worsted weight machine washable and dryer safe yarn i used lion brand wool ease * four size 6 4 mm dpns * tapestry needle gauge 6 stitches per inch 2 54 cm in very slightly stretched k2p1 ribbing about 7 stitches per inch unstretched this is a very stretchy sock since rib is worked all around the foot so l ength of sock is probably more important abbreviations ssk - slip slip knit slipping as if to knit k2tog / p2tog - knit 2 stitches together / purl 2 stitches together sl - in this pattern slip as if to purl wyif - with yarn in front w yib - with yarn in back sizes chart this chart will be useful as a quick reference once you ve been through the pattern small medium large extra large womens size 5-6 womens sz 7-9 38-40 women sz 9-11 40-42 women sz 11+ 42+ 36-37 mens size 6-8 39-41 mens size 8-10 41-43 mens size 11+ 44+ co 42 42 48 48 divide 21 21 24 24 heel row 10 10 12 12 *start of heel turn 12 k / 5 p 14 k / 6 p 13 remain 14 remain pickup/gusset 11 each side 13 each side **foot length 7 18 cm 8 20 cm 8 5 21 5 cm 9 23 cm toe close 18 32/16 * first stitch is slipped but included in count here for simplicity of chart * * length given is simply a guide please adjust as needed toe close takes about 2 5 08 cm page �1 of �4 cast on choose size from chart and co that number of stitches set up to work in the round and begin w orking in k2 p1 or pattern of your choice for a generous inch about 2 5 cm divide for heel small/medium k2 p1 4 times turn work k1 p2 7 times move unused stitches to other needle to hold for instep there should be 21 stitches on each needle large/exlarge k2 p1 4 times turn work k1 p2 8 times move unused stitches to other needle to hold for instep there should be 24 stitches on each needle heel flap small/medium row 1 *sl 1 purlwise wyib k1* repeat * to * to last stitch knit last stitch r ow 2 sl 1 purwise wyif purl across repeat these two row 9 more times for a total of 10 sets large/exlarge row 1 *sl 1 purlwise wyib k1* repeat * to * across r ow 2 sl 1 purwise wyif purl across repeat these two row
